question: Elschnigs pearls are seen in?
exp: Ans. is 'a' i.e., After cataract After cataract (Secondary cataract or posterior capsular opacification)o Posterior capsular opacification (PCO) is seen after ECCE. Opacification of the posterior capsule is caused by postoperative proliferation of cells in the capsular bag and is the most common complication of ECCE.o After cataract may present as thickened posterior capsule, or dense membranous after cataract or Soemmering's ring which refers to a thick ring of after cataract formed behind the iris, enclosed between the two layers of capsule or Elschnig's pearls in which the vacuolated subcapsular epithelial cells are clustered like soap bubbles along the osterior capsule.o After cataract, if thin, can be cleared centrally by Nd: YAG laser capsulotomy. Discission with cystitome or zeigler's knife may also be used. Thick membranous after cataract needs surgical membranectomy.

question: Cata ract in diabetes -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i.e., SnowflakeDiabetic cataracto Cataract is considered as a major cause of visual impairment in diabetic patients. Senile cataract tends to develop at an earlier age and more rapidly than usual in diabetic patients,o The enzyme aldolase reductase catalyzes the reduction of glucose to sorbitol through the polyol pathway, a process linked to the development of diabetic cataract.NADPH* dependent aldolase reductase reduces excessive glucose to sorbitol and intracellular accumulation of sorbitol leads to osmotic changes resulting in hydropic lens fibers that degenerate and form sugar cataract,o The typical diabetic cataract is snowflake cataract, i.e., dense white subcapsular opacities in the anterior and posterior cortex resembling a snowstorm.o As blood- sugar levels fluctuate, visual acuity and refractive error can change - Fluctating refractive error. This causes frequent change in optimal eyeglass prescription.

question: In a patient, highest visual morbidity is seen in:
exp: Ans: C (Posterior subcapsular cataract) Ref: Basok Essentials of Ophthalmology. 5th edition, pg. 248: Parson's Diseases of the Eye 21st edition pg no 262.Explanation:Posterior subcapsular cataract or posterior cortical cataract:The opacity in the posterior cortex is close to the nodal point of the lens.Nodal point 7.0S mm from the anterior surface of the cornea.* Posterior cortical cataract is at the visual axis so during day time pupil constricts - Day Blindness.

question: Diabetic cataract occurs to accumulation of -
exp: Ans. is 'd' i.e., Sorbitolo Cataract is considered as a major cause of visual impairment in diabetic patients. Senile cataract tends to develop at an earlier age and more rapidly than usual in diabetic patients.o The enzyme aldolase reductase catalyzes the reduction of glucose to sorbitol through the polyol pathway, a process linked to the development of diabetic cataract.IS ADPH+ dependent aldolase reductase reduces excessive glucose to sorbitol and intracellular accumulation of sorbitol leads to osmotic changes resulting in hydropic lens fibers that degenerate and form sugar cataract.o The typical diabetic cataract is snowflake cataract, i.e., dense white subcapsular opacities in the anterior and posterior cortex resembling a snowstorm.

question: Polychromatic lusture is seen in -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i.e., Complicated cataract Complicated cataracto Complicated cataract refers to the lens opacification secondary to some other intraocular disease. Anterior uveitis is the most common cause. Other causes are posterior uveitis, pars planitis, comeal ulcer, ciliary body tumors, degenerative myopia, retinitis pigmentosa and retinal detachment.o Typically complicated cataracts occur in two forms :-Posterior cortical complicated cataractThis type of cataract is due to affections of posterior segment. This cataract is located in a posterior subcapsular cataract and typically opacification starts in the posterior part of the cortex in the axial region (Posterior cortical cataract or posterior subcapsular cataract). On slit lamp examination the opacities have "bread- crumb" appearance. A characteristic sign is presence of polychromatic lusture of red, green and blues.Anterior cortical complicated cataract This is due to the affection of anterior segment like glaucoma or anterior uveitis.

question: Glass blowers cataract is caused due to -
exp: Ans. is 'c' i.e. Infrared radiation o Glassblower's cataracts is formed by many years or decades of exposure to infrared radiaiton while working in the occupation of glass blowing, or working close to hot or molten metals such with metal foundry workers or blacksmiths.o Glassblower's cataracts are due to chronic exposure to infrared radiation emitted due to heating of glass or molten metal. The infrared radiation is absorbed by the iris and lens of the eye. This causes cataracts after decades of exposure. This condition may be pre vented by wearing protective glasses while practicing these occupations.
